t: Job 38
The Lord Answers Job
Then*p the Lord*s answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
“Who*pn is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge?
Dress*ln for action like a man; I*ld will question you, and you make it known to me.
“Where*pn were you when I laid the foundation of the earth? Tell*ld me, if you have understanding.
Who*ln determined its measurements— surely you know! Or*ld who stretched the line upon it?
On*ln what were its bases sunk, or*ld who laid its cornerstone,
when*ln the morning stars sang together and*ld all the sons of God shouted for joy?
“Or*pn who shut in the sea with doors when*ld it burst out from the womb,
when*ln I made clouds its garment and*ld thick darkness its swaddling band,
and*ln prescribed limits for it and*ld set bars and doors,
and*ln said, ‘Thus far shall you come, and no farther, and*ld here shall your proud waves be stayed’?
“Have*pn you commanded the morning since your days began, and*ld caused the dawn to know its place,
that*ln it might take hold of the skirts of the earth, and*ld the wicked be shaken out of it?
It*ln is changed like clay under the seal, and*ld its features stand out like a garment.
From*ln the wicked their light is withheld, and*ld their uplifted arm is broken.
“Have*pn you entered into the springs of the sea, or*ld walked in the recesses of the deep?
Have*ln the gates of death been revealed to you, or*ld have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
Have*ln you comprehended the expanse of the earth? Declare,*ld if you know all this.
“Where*pn is the way to the dwelling of light, and*ld where is the place of darkness,
that*ln you may take it to its territory and*ld that you may discern the paths to its home?
You*ln know, for you were born then, and*ld the number of your days is great!
“Have*pn you entered the storehouses of the snow, or*ld have you seen the storehouses of the hail,
which*ln I have reserved for the time of trouble, for*ld the day of battle and war?
What*ln is the way to the place where the light is distributed, or*ld where the east wind is scattered upon the earth?
“Who*pn has cleft a channel for the torrents of rain and*ld a way for the thunderbolt,
to*ln bring rain on a land where no man is, on*ld the desert in which there is no man,
to*ln satisfy the waste and desolate land, and*ld to make the ground sprout with grass?
“Has*pn the rain a father, or*ld who has begotten the drops of dew?
From*ln whose womb did the ice come forth, and*ld who has given birth to the frost of heaven?
The*ln waters become hard like stone, and*ld the face of the deep is frozen.
“Can*pn you bind the chains of the Pleiades or*ld loose the cords of Orion?
Can*ln you lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season, or*ld can you guide the Bear with its children?
Do*ln you know the ordinances of the heavens? Can*ld you establish their rule on the earth?
“Can*pn you lift up your voice to the clouds, that*ld a flood of waters may cover you?
Can*ln you send forth lightnings, that they may go and*ld say to you, ‘Here we are’?
Who*ln has put wisdom in the inward parts or*ld given understanding to the mind?
Who*ln can number the clouds by wisdom? Or*ld who can tilt the waterskins of the heavens,
when*ln the dust runs into a mass and*ld the clods stick fast together?
“Can*pn you hunt the prey for the lion, or*ld satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
when*ln they crouch in their dens or*ld lie in wait in their thicket?
Who*ln provides for the raven its prey, when*ld its young ones cry to God for help, and*ld wander about for lack of food?
